00001 ########################################################################### 
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Interval class
00004 #
00005 package Value::Interval;
00006 my $pkg = 'Value::Interval';
00007 
00008 use strict; no strict "refs";
00009 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Convert a value to an interval.  The value consists of
00013 #    an open paren string, one or two real numbers or infinities,
00014 #    and a close paren string.
00015 #
00016 sub new {
00017   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00018   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00019   if (scalar(@_) == 1) {
00020     my $x = Value::makeValue($_[0],context=>$context);
00021     if (Value::isFormula($x)) {
00022       return $x if $x->type eq 'Interval';
00023       Value::Error("Formula does not return an Interval");
00024     }
00025     return $self->promote($context,$x);
00026   }
00027   my @params = @_;
00028   Value::Error("Interval can't be empty") unless scalar(@params) > 0;
00029   Value::Error("Too many arguments for Interval") if scalar(@params) > 4;
00030   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context,@params) if scalar(@params) == 1;
00031   @params = ('(',@params,')') if (scalar(@params) == 2);
00032   my ($open,$a,$b,$close) = @params;
00033   ($b,$close) = ($a,$b) unless defined($close);
00034   ($a,$b,$open) = ($open,$a,$b) if !ref($b) && ($b eq '(' || $b eq '[');
00035   $a = Value::makeValue($a,context=>$context); $b = Value::makeValue($b,context=>$context);
00036   return $self->formula($open,$a,$b,$close) if Value::isFormula($a) || Value::isFormula($b);
00037   Value::Error("Endpoints of intervals must be numbers or infinities") unless
00038     isNumOrInfinity($a) && isNumOrInfinity($b);
00039   my ($ia,$ib) = (isInfinity($a),isInfinity($b));
00040   my ($nia,$nib) = (isNegativeInfinity($a),isNegativeInfinity($b));
00041   Value::Error("Can't make an interval only out of Infinity") if ($ia && $ib) || ($nia && $nib);
00042   Value::Error("Left endpoint must be less than right endpoint")
00043     unless $nia || $ib || ($a <= $b && !$ia && !$nib);
00044   $open  = '(' if $open  eq '[' && $nia; # should be error ?
00045   $close = ')' if $close eq ']' && $ib;  # ditto?
00046   Value::Error("Open parenthesis of interval must be '(' or '['")
00047     unless $open eq '(' || $open eq '[';
00048   Value::Error("Close parenthesis of interval must be ')' or ']'")
00049     unless $close eq ')' || $close eq ']';
00050   return $self->formula($open,$a,$b,$close)
00051     if Value::isFormula($a) || Value::isFormula($b);
00052   Value::Error("Single point intervals must use '[' and ']'")
00053     if $a == $b && ($open ne '[' || $close ne ']');
00054   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context,$a) if $a == $b;
00055   bless {
00056     $self->hash,
00057     data => [$a,$b], open => $open, close => $close,
00058     leftInfinite => $nia, rightInfinite => $ib,
00059     context => $context,
00060   }, $class;
00061 }
00062 
00063 #
00064 #  Similarly for make, but without the error checks
00065 #
00066 sub make {
00067   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00068   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00069   my ($open,$a,$b,$close) = @_;
00070   ($open,$a,$b,$close) = ("(",$open,$a,")") unless defined($b);
00071   ($b,$close) = ($a,$b) unless defined($close);
00072   ($a,$b,$open) = ($open,$a,$b) if !ref($b) && ($b eq '(' || $b eq '[');
00073   bless {
00074     data => [$a,$b], open => $open, close => $close,
00075     leftInfinite => isNegativeInfinity($a), rightInfinite => isInfinity($b),
00076     context => $context,
00077   }, $class
00078 }
00079 
00080 #
00081 #  Make a formula out of the data for an interval
00082 #
00083 sub formula {
00084   my $self = shift;
00085   my ($open,$a,$b,$close) = @_;
00086   my $context = $self->context;
00087   my $formula = $context->Package("Formula")->blank($context);
00088   ($a,$b) = Value::toFormula($formula,$a,$b);
00089   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("List")->new($formula,[$a,$b],0,
00090      $context->{parens}{$open},$Value::Type{number},$open,$close);
00091   return $formula;
00092 }
00093 
00094 #
00095 #  Tests for infinities
00096 #
00097 sub isNumOrInfinity {
00098   my $n = shift;
00099   return isInfinity($n) || isNegativeInfinity($n) || Value::isNumber($n);
00100 }
00101 sub isInfinity {
00102   my $n = shift;
00103   return $n->{tree}{isInfinity} if Value::isFormula($n);
00104   $n = Value::makeValue($n); return 0 unless ref($n);
00105   return $n->{isInfinite} && !$n->{isNegative};
00106 }
00107 sub isNegativeInfinity {
00108   my $n = shift;
00109   return $n->{tree}{isNegativeInfinity} if Value::isFormula($n);
00110   $n = Value::makeValue($n); return 0 unless ref($n);
00111   return $n->{isInfinite} && $n->{isNegative};
00112 }

00114 sub isOne {0}
00115 sub isZero {0}

00117 sub canBeInUnion {1}
00118 sub isSetOfReals {1}

00120 #
00121 #  Return the open and close parens as well as the endpoints
00122 #
00123 sub value {
00124   my $self = shift;
00125   my ($a,$b) = @{$self->data};
00126   return ($a,$b,$self->{open},$self->{close});
00127 }
00128 
00129 #
00130 #  Return the number of endpoints
00131 #
00132 sub length {
00133   my $self = shift;
00134   my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00135   return $a == $b ? 1 : 2;
00136 }
00137 
00138 #
00139 #  Only transfer flags to the endpoints
00140 #
00141 sub transferFlags {
00142   my $self = shift;
00143   foreach my $flag (@_) {
00144     next unless defined $self->{$flag};
00145     foreach my $i (0,1) {$self->{data}[$i]->{$flag} = $self->{$flag}}
00146   }
00147 }
00148 
00149 #
00150 #  Convert points and lists to intervals, when needed
00151 #
00152 sub promote {
00153   my $self = shift;
00154   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00155   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00156   return $self->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0;
00157   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00158   return $x->inContext($context) if $x->isSetOfReals;
00159   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context,$x) if Value::isReal($x);
00160   my $open  = $x->{open};  $open  = '(' unless defined($open);
00161   my $close = $x->{close}; $close = ')' unless defined($close);
00162   return $self->new($context,$open,$x->value,$close) if $x->canBeInUnion;
00163   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00164 }

00168 #  Operations on intervals

00170 
00171 #
00172 #  Addition forms unions
00173 #
00174 sub add {
00175   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00176   Value::Union::form($self->context,$l,$r);
00177 }
00178 sub dot {my $self = shift; $self->add(@_)}
00179 
00180 #
00181 #  Subtraction can split into a union
00182 #
00183 sub sub {
00184   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00185   Value::Union::form($self->context,Value::Union::subUnionUnion([$l],[$r]));
00186 }
00187 
00188 #
00189 #  Subtract an interval from another
00190 #    (returns the resulting interval(s), set
00191 #     or nothing for emtpy set)
00192 #
00193 sub subIntervalInterval {
00194   my ($l,$r) = @_; $l = $l->copy; $r = $r->copy;
00195   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00196   my $self = $l; my $context = $self->context;
00197   my @union = ();
00198   if ($d <= $a) {
00199     $l->{open} = '(' if $d == $a && $r->{close} eq ']';
00200     push(@union,$l) unless $a == $b && $l->{open} eq '(';
00201   } elsif ($c >= $b) {
00202     $l->{close} = ')' if $c == $b && $r->{open} eq '[';
00203     push(@union,$l) unless $a == $b && $l->{close} eq ')';
00204   } else {
00205     if ($a == $c) {
00206       push(@union,$context->Package("Set")->make($context,$a))
00207     if $l->{open} eq '[' && $r->{open} eq '(';
00208     } elsif ($a < $c) {
00209       my $close = ($r->{open} eq '[')? ')': ']';
00210       push(@union,$context->Package("Interval")->make($context,$l->{open},$a,$c,$close));
00211     }
00212     if ($d == $b) {
00213       push(@union,$context->Package("Set")->make($context,$b))
00214     if $l->{close} eq ']' && $r->{close} eq ')';
00215     } elsif ($d < $b) {
00216       my $open = ($r->{close} eq ']') ? '(': '[';
00217       push(@union,$context->Package("Interval")->make($context,$open,$d,$b,$l->{close}));
00218     }
00219   }
00220   return @union;
00221 }
00222 
00223 #
00224 #  Lexicographic order, but with type of endpoint included
00225 #    in the test.
00226 #
00227 sub compare {
00228   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00229   my ($la,$lb) = $l->value; my ($ra,$rb) = $r->value;
00230   my $cmp = $la <=> $ra; return $cmp if $cmp;
00231   my $ignoreEndpointTypes = $l->getFlag('ignoreEndpointTypes');
00232   $cmp = $r->{open} cmp $l->{open}; return $cmp if $cmp && !$ignoreEndpointTypes;
00233   $cmp = $lb <=> $rb; return $cmp if $cmp || $ignoreEndpointTypes;
00234   return $l->{close} cmp $r->{close};
00235 }

00247 #
00248 #  Tests for containment, subsets, etc.
00249 #
00250 
00251 sub contains {
00252   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00253   return ($other - $self)->isEmpty;
00254 }
00255 
00256 sub isSubsetOf {
00257   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00258   return $other->contains($self);
00259 }

00261 sub isEmpty {0}
00262 
00263 sub intersect {
00264   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00265   return $self-($self-$other);
00266 }
00267 
00268 sub intersects {
00269   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00270   return !$self->intersect($other)->isEmpty;
00271 }
